title: NATO joint exersices in Georgia.

content: Simmer down now, skytail! It’s a micro exercise that was in the works for months. Although it’s rather insignificant, and we genuinely want better relations, we just can’t react to every Russian whim! Russia should also learn what battles to fight 9and which ones to drop), or they risk losing little political and/or economic power they have left. "None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free." -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

title: NATO joint exersices in Georgia.

content: It's a paper shuffle, command level exercise heavy on the chiefs and light on the indians. Maybe even lighter on the 'indians' since the 'presidential guard' unit will be busy making sure the rest of the Georgian army want to be participating. If NATO wants to be involved in gallant li'l Georgia, they're going to have to 'bring their own' for the Georgians don't seem to be up to much.
